Posts.Content: On Nov 22, 2014 2:33 AM sparklyeyes88 wrote: I'm 26 married with 2 children under 5 just found out today my mom has been diagnosed with breast cancer they don't know what stage yet she has to go for an MRI to find out more I'm an only child and feel totally alone and scared ...  I am so sorry to hear about your mom,she needs to feel that you fully support her struggles. The Breast cancer is the most common invasive cancer in females worldwide.There are several reasons for this, with possibly life-expectancy being one of the key factors - breast cancer is more common in elderly women.A woman regularly drinks the more alcohol the higher her risk of developing breast cancer.Depend ing on breast cancer treatments can be classified into broad group based on how they work and when they are used.Chemot herapy, hormone therapy, and targeted therapy are systemic therapies.I found sierra nevada cancer center to help you and make your experience comfortable. http://www.sierranevadacancer.com/news/sierra-nevada-cancer-

Posts.Content: On Apr 10, 2015 1:30 AM Roxy1 wrote: My Dad is 62 we found out 2 months ago he had it. It is so awful watching him go threw cemo 2 times a month. It is so sad he is only 62. Hello Roxy,    Sorry to hear your news,you will get help and support here. Lung cancer is often diagnosed late and for many people the cancer has already spread when they are diagnosed.People with stage IV usually receive chemotherapy, which is the use of drugs to kill cancer cells. This is the only treatment that will go everywhere in the body and destroy cancer cells wherever they may be located.The type of treatment you will receive for lung cancer depends on several factors.You will learn about the different ways of lung cancer treatment in sierra nevada cancer center.  I found sierra nevada cancer center they have expertise and the compassion to help you on your journey. http://www.sierranevadacancer.com/news/lung-cancer-treatment
